caption.title: Influence of detection sensitivity on the estimation of the long-range dispersal kernel.
caption.p: For each detection sensitivity, a single epidemic was simulated using the long-range kernel (black dashed curve). The posterior distributions of the estimated kernels (obtained from all MCMC chains with non-negligible mean posterior likelihood) are shown for three levels of prior information. Kernels are represented by their marginal probability density function f 1 D (top row), and by their marginal cumulative distribution function F 1 D with the distance from the source represented on the natural scale (middle row) or on the log 10 scale (bottom row).
Click here for additional data file.
